avalancheActivity.comment:
In the last two days small wind slabs formed in gullies and bowls and behind abrupt changes in the terrain as well as at high altitude. These avalanche prone locations are easy to recognise. They can be released, even by a single winter sport participant, especially on extremely steep slopes.
Even a small avalanche can sweep people along and give rise to falls.

Loose snow avalanches are possible as the day progresses, but they can reach medium size in isolated cases. This applies in particular on extremely steep slopes, in the event of solar radiation especially,.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The weather will be cold. There is a danger of falling on the hard crust. The more recent wind slabs represent the main danger.

snowpackStructure.comment:
In some localities 15 to 30 cm of snow has fallen since Tuesday. This applies along the border with France and along the border with Switzerland.
The northwesterly wind has transported the new snow. In some cases the wind slabs have bonded poorly with the old snowpack.
As a consequence of falling temperatures the snowpack consolidated during the last few days. Towards its surface, the snowpack is hard and its surface has a strong melt-freeze crust.
Above approximately 2300 m a lot of snow is lying.

tendency.comment: As a consequence of new snow and wind there will be an increase in the avalanche danger within the current danger level.

avalancheActivity.comment:
In the last few days small wind slabs formed in the regions neighbouring those that are subject to danger level 2 (moderate), especially adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas. These can in isolated cases be released, even by a single winter sport participant. This applies in particular on extremely steep slopes especially at intermediate and high altitudes. Even a small avalanche can sweep people along and give rise to falls.

Individual loose snow avalanches are possible as the day progresses, but they will be mostly small. This applies in particular on extreme slopes. In the event of solar radiation this applies,.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The weather will be cold. In many places there is a danger of falling on the hard snow surface.

snowpackStructure.comment:
The wintry weather conditions gave rise to consolidation of the old snowpack in all aspects.
Towards its surface, the snowpack is hard and its surface has a strong melt-freeze crust.

Above approximately 2300 m a lot of snow is lying.
